items.sentence: Tom served three years in prison for a crime he didn\'t commit.
Tom always drinks at least three cups of coffee in the morning.
Tom always gives the same old excuse for being late for school.
Tom and Mary accomplished their mission without any difficulty.
Tom asked Mary for some money so he could buy something to eat.
It seems like we haven\'t done anything fun since last October.
Tom called his wife and told her that he\'d be late for dinner.
Tom is the kind of person who always has to have the last word.
Tom is the only one in our family who regularly attends church.
Can you remember the first time you tried playing the clarinet?
Did you know that Tom and Mary both have houses on Park Street?
Did you like your teachers when you were in junior high school?
When I had five hens, on the average I\'d get three eggs a day.
I like his new house, but I had not expected it to be so small.
I need to borrow some money so I can buy some medicine for Tom.
I have a lot of old books. A couple of them are quite valuable.
Tom made it clear that he didn\'t want to go to Boston with us.
Tom can\'t be in the car more than ten minutes or he gets sick.
I think it\'s pretty obvious that Tom doesn\'t want to do that.
Last night, I ate some asparagus and ham at my friend\'s house.
